title: Thunderbird for Mac Slow to Open New Emails After Last 2 Software Updates
content:
I just updated to the latest Thunderbird for Mac as of today (128.6.1esr) and unfortunately still have the same problem that first started with the last update: whenever I get a new email, I click on it, and it takes a full 6 or 7 seconds to display the email in the bottom preview pane. This used to be INSTANT and now it takes an extremely long period of time when you consider how many new emails a person gets overnight. The cursor actually beachballs literally every time.

Thunderbird does not do this on version 128.5.2esr - that version is quick and snappy no matter what I do.
creator: isleofgreg

title: Virtual Mailboxs Not Refreshing Until Thunderbird is Restarted
content:
Hi,

I run my own mail server using Dovecot with the Virtual Mailbox feature to run some server side searches.

The folders contain the email that matches the criteria as expected but the message list (e.g. flagged email) does refresh (either waiting or clicking the Get Messages button) when a message is unflagged in this example until I restart the client. I am using the option "INDEX=MEMORY" which is meant to allow for this.

The issue does not occur with Thunderbird on Android, only my Desktop client on Linux.

Anyone have any suggestions?

Thanks,

Adam
